programme.title: Vampire Skeletons
programme.desc: Documentary examining skeletons unearthed in Ireland that appear to be treated as revenants who might return from the dead to prey on the living.

programme.title: UFO Europe
programme.desc: Unknown objects, weird lights and a shocking criminal investigation - check out Scotland's Livingston UFO, Norway's Hessdalen lights and Portugal's Castelo de Bode Dam encounter.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz take their nephew on his first pick and visit the 1890s home that once belonged to an opera singer.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz visit a theme park during a clear-out and later discover some shocking news about a collection of circus posters.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Tempers flare up as the operation hits the rails, with one of the team's rookies facing the sack, while Melvin and the crew finally get their differences out in the open and Jimmy and Jo confront each other.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby takes on a risky mission when a sunken raft of logs goes missing in the swamps of Louisiana, while several loggers face being fired, including one who has gone AWOL.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Ron and Tyler discover a rusty pump that could be worth a fortune if properly restored - but first they need to persuade the owner to part with it.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick and the team restore a gramophone from the 1920s and a 1915 cement gun that they discover was once put to a very different use.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts contemplate whether aliens could be causing natural disasters and wars in a bid to control the fate of the human race.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Examining why different cultures have similar tales of monsters and giants, and questioning whether they could be genuine eye-witness accounts of extraterrestrials.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Places on Earth where aliens may have landed in ancient times, from Mexico's Zone of Silence to the Markawasi Plateau in Peru.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Danielle accompanies Mike on a pick while Frank looks after the shop, and the first-time picker strikes gold when she spots a derelict hotel filled with treasures.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz discover a train station full of vintage cars, and make some surprising finds in an old barn.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers bid for some scruffy looking lockers, but appearances prove deceptive as the most unattractive units turn out to contain the most valuable contents.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: If I Were a Tibetin' Man
programme.desc: The bidders compete for a potentially profitable furniture locker, while Ricky and Bubba buy a collection of American football autographs, but need to check if they are genuine.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Lesa finds looking for fine art and designer furniture too stressful to cope with, and Roy thinks a theme park brochure from the 1970s will make him a profit.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: A famous cowboy offers his assistance to the bidders at an auction in Fort Worth, while Lesa finds a means to triumph over her rival.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: One of the buyers accidentally acquires a historically important item, while Victor gets his hands on an intriguing locked treasure chest - with no key.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders consider the benefits and drawbacks of two very different neighbourhoods, and Lesa displays her ruthless side while dealing with a young buyer.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: A piano, a tea set and some expensive furniture are among the finds up for grabs when the buyers go to Lewisville, Texas.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers go to Dallas, where they attend several auctions in one day while facing a frantic race to keep up with the competition.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: A compilation of clips examining the series' most and least successful bidding tactics, from secret plots to Barry's bizarre schemes.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Special episode revisiting the bidders' most uproarious feuds.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The PA Stays in the Picture
programme.desc: The bidders attend a series of auctions in the southern Californian city of Rancho Cucamonga.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers attend a locker auction in Orange County, where Ivy Calvin ends up having to dig through a pile of rubbish.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi and Jarrod realise they will have to pool their resources with Barry if they are to stand any chance of making a profit at an auction in San Jacinto.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers return to Montebello, where Darrell made the most profitable purchase in the show's history.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi attends an auction without Jarrod, who has no idea what she intends to spend their money on. Darrell finds a kit that could brew him a nice profit.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi try to get the better of some inexperienced new faces on the auction circuit, while Barry attends a sale in Inglewood.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Orange You Glad Dan Sold It Again?
programme.desc: At an auction in Burbank, California, a new buyer challenges both Barry and Jarrod - and ends up buying a locker that is packed full of surprises.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders head for an auction in Costa Mesa, where they encounter several new faces. Brandi and Jarrod look for stock to sell in their new shop.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: After layering a complex Damascus pattern in their signature blades, the remaining bladesmiths recreate a three-bladed African throwing knife called the Kpinga.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: Rick and Marty Lagina find data that shows that large, metal objects are buried beneath Smith's Cove. They go on to make a surprising discovery.

programme.title: Texas Rising
programme.desc: Drama set during the Texas Revolution, following the rise of the Texas Rangers. Santa Anna emerges victorious at the Alamo, inflicting a brutal defeat on the Texans to quell their rebellion. Amidst the massacre, he sends Emily West to recount the horrors to his nemesis, Samuel Houston. Olivier Martinez stars.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds' reputation is at stake when a customer claims he was sold a fake watch, and Ashley makes a large offer for some gemstones.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les has to call security when an argument over a missing item turns violent, a high-stakes gambler visits the shop for funds and a customer tries to sell a gynaecologist's table.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Comedian Rhod Gilbert takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from May 2018, with comedy writer Andy Hamilton and politician Sayeeda Warsi joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.sub-title: Nobody Wants Vom On Their Cheerios
programme.desc: The comedian devises an experiment to discover whether people's behaviour is the same in the real world as it is online, using a room full of photographs of Alan Sugar.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy attends a three-day trade conference to drum up business, but when she has little luck she resorts to flirting with the male delegates. Lee is outraged with her plan, however, and in an attempt to stop her he turns up at the event - posing as her husband. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: The host is joined by Bill Bailey, Diane Morgan, Steve Pemberton and Romesh Ranganathan. Topics up for discussion include Latex disasters and dental wonders.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: The host, Bob Mortimer, Russell Kane, Lucy Montgomery and Miles Jupp discuss such sneaky cockroaches, Iranian fruit and how one can 'show off' in the gym a little too much.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May immerse themselves in nostalgia and try to prove that hot hatches from their younger days are better than today's equivalents. Jeremy grabs the keys to a Volkswagen Golf GTI, Richard takes the wheel of a Vauxhall Nova SRi and James May opts for the Ford Fiesta XR2i, and the trio set off on a road trip that includes a hill climb and a visit to a supermarket. However, their adventure concludes at an army training ground in Wales, where they and their steeds must face the heavily armed Top Gear Police Department. Downton Abbey star Hugh Bonneville blasts the Reasonably Priced Car around the test track.

programme.title: Ultimate Movers
programme.sub-title: Beer Silo, Plane Bar, Steam Train
programme.desc: A 32-metre long beer tank must navigate tiny roads to be installed at a brewery in Tadcaster, while in Kidderminster, a vintage steam train travels hundreds of miles south to Devon.

programme.title: Steve Austin's Broken Skull Challenge
programme.desc: The former wrestler challenges eight contestants to triumph over a series of gruelling physical endurance tests.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: A car that had failed to stop then reverses at speed down a footpath, hitting the door of a police car. Officers assist security guards in a tower block by removing two women.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Nottinghamshire Bodycam Cops Annie and Dave investigate a disturbance in a back garden, but when an intruder turns violent, Annie is left with a life-changing injury.

programme.title: Ultimate Movers
programme.sub-title: Boat Move, Vintage Cars, Wood Ship
programme.desc: A 40-tonne boat called King Arthur needs moving from Bristol, while in Essex, a number of vintage cars must be carefully transported to a sales fair.

programme.title: Aussie Pickers
programme.desc: Series following two pickers, Lucas Callaghan and Adam McDonald, who earn a living by restoring forgotten relics to their former glory, beginning with a visit to Jim Crocker, a collector and junk yard owner who specialises in Furphy water carts.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike makes a deal over some taxidermy animals and spots a retro billboard that could be worth a lot of money.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Actor Larry Lamb, comedian David O'Doherty and presenter Lauren Laverne join host Frank Skinner, making the case for their pet hates to be banished for ever. The trio's dislikes include high fives, fancy dress, ostentatious dresses, being 35, fake tan and square plates.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Seasoned rocker Alice Cooper, Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? host Chris Tarrant and wildlife presenter Chris Packham compete to have their pet hates banished for ever, on the comedy panel show chaired by Frank Skinner. Their gripes include reality TV stars, balloon animals, parrots, Jedward, Chris Moyles and kids' artwork on fridges.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner chairs the comedy panel show, inviting comedian Ross Noble, R'n'B singer Jamelia and academic Germaine Greer to compete to have their pet hates banished for ever. Their gripes include folk-dancing, health-and-safety, text speak, smelly people, actors and fun-runs.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: The steep streets of Cincinnati's Mount Adams neighbourhood play host to the crazy cart designs, 40,000 people going wild and plenty of crashes.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers are on alert for a cartel ambush as they transfer a Sicario to the Mexican military. A random inspection of a pick-up truck reveals 32kg of narcotics.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers in Hidalgo are forced to close the bridge when it's stormed by dozens of asylum seekers trying to jump the queue of people waiting to seek refuge in the USA.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Former Labour home secretary Alan Johnson takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedian Janey Godley and journalist and political commentator Tim Shipman joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sara Pascoe, Colin Lane and Jimmy Carr join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig for an extended edition of the comedy panel quiz show. This time, the theme is 'Opposites'. During the course of the show, the panellists find out how to sort the sheep from the goats, discover the opposite of Tarzan, and meet the telescope that points straight through the Earth. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window, as the fiendishly difficult questions lead to points being awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Joe Lycett, Ivo Graham, Phil Wang
programme.desc: Stand-up comedian and author Joe Lycett plays host in this show recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo. He warms up the audience and then introduces routines by fellow funny men Ivo Graham and Phil Wang.

programme.title: David Jason: Planes, Trains and Automobiles
programme.desc: The actor discovers the machines that made America. Here, he samples the luxury of 1930s aviation, drives the car that changed the world and climbs aboard a vintage steam train.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A multi-billion-pound 32km super sewer under the streets of London, an early sewer system at the Palace of Knossos and a pivotal piece of tunnel boring equipment from the past.

programme.title: Medieval Dead
programme.desc: The skeleton dubbed the Warrior of Janakkala, found in Finland. The swords buried alongside the man suggest a link between Christians and Pagans and it has been deduced the remains date from the 12th century.

programme.title: Medieval Dead
programme.desc: The team travels to Montsegur in France to investigate the massacre of hundreds of Cathars in 1244.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Documentary offering an insight into some of the events in the Bible, beginning with the story of the Ten Plagues. In the Old Testament, the Book of Exodus describes the epic battle between the prophet Moses and Pharaoh. Experts offer various various explanations for the 10 plagues of Moses and the mass exodus of the Hebrew slaves out of Egypt, a story that is a cornerstone of the Jewish, Christian, and Muslim faiths.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Investigating the Turin Shroud, which is a length of linen cloth that some believe bears the image of Jesus. Cameras follow the efforts of a scientist trying to prove whether the cloth truly is Christ's burial robe.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Acclaimed chronicle of the Second World War, beginning with an account of Hitler's ascent to power at a time when the Germans were stricken by humiliating military defeat, runaway inflation and economic depression. The Nazi leader's promises of regained national pride and prosperity struck a chord with millions of ordinary citizens, and he was elected on a tidal wave of popular support. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The months following prime minister Neville Chamberlain's declaration of war against Germany, in which the only casualties on the home front were those who had to endure the blackouts. Elsewhere in Europe, the Nazi war machine cut a swathe of destruction. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How, in 1940, the French Army suffered a heavy defeat after underestimating the Nazis' strength while relying on First World War strategies and equipment to defend its frontiers. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The drop in morale of Churchill's forces following the fall of France to Nazi forces during the Second World War, and how the Dunkirk evacuation and the Battle of Britain helped to restore British confidence. Plus, America's reasons for initially refusing to enter the conflict.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: An account of Hitler's decision to invade the Soviet Union, which produced an initial series of dazzling victories until the harsh winter of 1941 took hold, with fatal consequences for the ill-equipped German army. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the somewhat macabre history of Scotland Yard, and revealing the lesser-known facts about one of the world's most famous police stations.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.sub-title: Secrets of Her Majesty's Secret Service
programme.desc: The documentary series exploring the less well known side of Britain continues, with this edition exploring MI6, asking whether the shadowy world of espionage and counter-intelligence operations bear any resemblance to the James Bond novels.

programme.title: Secrets of the Manor House
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the story of Highclere Castle, the setting used for TV drama Downton Abbey, including an insight into the lives of current residents Lord and Lady Carnarvon.

programme.title: Secrets of the Manor House
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the hidden history of the stately home in Derbyshire, the residence of the dukes of Devonshire, revealing tales of intrigue, tragedy and scandal.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: The case of Dr Crippen, who murdered his wife and buried her in the basement before fleeing to Canada.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.sub-title: The Brides In The Bath Killer
programme.desc: The case of George Smith, who married a succession of women and murdered them so he could inherit their wealth.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Part one of two. A re-examination of Jack The Ripper's crimes, revealing how the story we know today was shaped by the sensationalist press of 1888.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Michelle tells Ren and the others that two British experts are coming disguised as policemen to examine the Enigma machine.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: German generals plan to meet at the cafe disguised as onion sellers, but so does a new group of shot-down British airmen. Second World War comedy set in German-occupied France, starring Gorden Kaye.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Helga tells Von Strohm that the stolen money was forged, so he thinks up a plan to get rid of the cash, while Michelle and Crabtree hatch a plot to get the airmen back to England.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: General Von Klinkerhoffen is declared insane and taken to the hospital's psychiatric ward. Colonel Von Strohm, Herr Flick and Von Smallhausen become tied to a bomb in the sewer, while Fanny and Monsieur Le Clerc have problems on their wedding day.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A rare 1980s Sierra Cosworth draws in a crowd of admiring Ford fans, while a restorer delights buyers with his immaculate 1966 Sunbeam Rapier and Sarah takes a shine to a caravan.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A formerly luxurious and strategic mountain-top villa on the island of Rhodes in the Mediterranean that's been ravaged by acts of revenge by locals since 1955.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: Dr Cameron feels he's being forced out of the practice now that Finlay and Neil are partners. Medical drama, starring David Rintoul and Ian Bannen.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Kerry exacts revenge on David Radford by sabotaging his planned armed robbery, but Irene turns the tables by producing an incriminating tape. Andrea and Gabriel are both given ultimatums and Adam is furious when information about the Sun Hill sniper is leaked to the newspapers.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Kerry does a disappearing act, leading to speculation that David Radford may have made good on his vow to kill her - although the gangster isn't the only one with a vested interest in ensuring her silence. Smithy eventually discovers the wayward PC by her father's hospital bed and declares his love - but their chances of romance are cut cruelly short when she is struck by a sniper's bullet while returning to Sun Hill station with earth-shattering news.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. After Kerry tragically loses her fight for life, Gabriel sets about covering his tracks by disposing of forensic evidence and intimidating a witness - but a shocking revelation could shatter his cold-blooded demeanour. Stunned by Kerry's death, a grief-crazed Smithy lashes out at Adam, swears revenge on David Radford and hands in his resignation to Gina, while DI Morrell resolves to track down the real culprit.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Already grief-stricken over Kerry's death, Yvonne faces further trauma as her sister Beverley is roughed up and Shirley reappears in Sun Hill, bringing serious trouble in her wake. Andrea fears her true identity is about to be exposed when her editor is brought in for questioning, while Samantha puzzles over a cryptic message she believes was left by Abi's abductor.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: Hetty investigates the apparent suicide of Robert's uncle, found hanged at his home, and discovers the whole village where he lived is gripped by superstition. Hetty begins to suspect that the villagers of Readsby - once a notorious haven for witches - are still engaged in satanic practices, and is determined to prove that they were somehow involved.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: The elderly sleuth makes a determined effort to drum up more business, and is hired to find a woman's missing son - a schizophrenic released into the community. She faces a race against time to track down the troubled youngster before he decides there's no point in going on. Detective drama, starring Patricia Routledge.

programme.title: Lorna Doone
programme.desc: Lavish adaptation of RD Blackmore's novel of lovers, outlaws and warring families in 17th-century Exmoor. Amelia Warner stars as the eponymous heroine, with Queer as Folk's Aidan Gillen as her evil aristocratic cousin, who wants her for himself at any cost. The cast also includes Richard Coyle, Martin Clunes, Barbara Flynn and Michael Kitchen.

programme.title: Lorna Doone
programme.desc: Lavish adaptation of RD Blackmore's novel of lovers, outlaws and warring families in 17th-century Exmoor. Amelia Warner stars as the eponymous heroine, with Queer as Folk's Aidan Gillen as her evil aristocratic cousin, who wants her for himself at any cost. The cast also includes Richard Coyle, Martin Clunes, Barbara Flynn and Michael Kitchen.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Julienne receives an SOS from Holloway Prison, whose usual maternity workers have been struck down by illness, and when she and Trixie step in to help, the nun puts her reputation on the line to prevent a heavily pregnant convict having her unborn baby taken away by social services. Shelagh faces heartache when a routine pregnancy check reveals something far more serious, Alec has a confession for Jenny, and Fred takes the gang to the theatre to celebrate Chummy's birthday - only for the trip to end in disaster. Lacey Turner, best known as EastEnders' Stacey Branning, guest stars.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Jenny has an eventful few days, starting with a patient who as well as having herself to worry about, is also struggling to cope with her mother, an agoraphobic who hasn't been outside for at least 12 years. On top of that, Alec asks the midwife to accompany him to Brighton for the weekend, leaving her wondering if his intentions are strictly honourable. However, things soon take a tragic turn. Meanwhile, Shelagh joins the local choir to take her mind off her problems. Jessica Raine, Leo Staar and Laura Main star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Jack examines a case previously undertaken by a deceased colleague, who was convinced that the alleged suicide of a journalist was a cover-up by the American government. Enlisting the help of a UFO-spotter, the team discovers the reporter witnessed a mysterious air crash near a US Air Force base, and the retired officers try to track down the original personnel to get some answers. Guest starring Mark Williams, Glynis Barber, Michael Brandon and Raquel Cassidy, with Amanda Redman.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: A woman is murdered and the forensic evidence takes the team to a cosmetic clinic where the victim had been receiving various treatments seemingly for free, but Nikki and Silva are frustrated by the CEO of Hamilton Ashe hospital when he blocks access to Karen's medical records. Meanwhile, when his daughter Rosie turns up at the Lyell as her mum is in hospital over a pregnancy complication, Thomas must play the doting father for a few weeks - a role that does not come naturally.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Trevor Eve and Sue Johnston star in the first of a two-part story. A woman who went missing from a care home in 1986 is found brutally murdered in a burnt-out car, and the team discovers she had recently abducted a teenage girl herself. As the investigation continues, both cases appear to be linked to an urban myth about a character known as the Bag Man - an eyeless villain who kidnaps children. With Eva Birthistle, Tara FitzGerald and Wil Johnson.

programme.desc: A round-up of the stories that have hit the headlines today, with Anna Jones.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Sky News
programme.desc: A summary of the latest news headlines.

programme.title: Fast & Furious 7 (2015)
programme.desc: After defeating Owen Shaw and his crew and securing amnesty for their past crimes, Dom, Brian and the rest of the team return home to live normal lives again. However Shaw's older brother Deckard - a rogue special forces assassin vows revenge on Dom, who he holds responsible for leaving Owen in a coma. Action thriller sequel, starring Vin Diesel, Jason Statham and Paul Walker in his last film role.

credits.actor: Paul Walker in his last film role

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: The Tracy brothers and their friends at International Rescue set out to foil the nefarious plots of the evil Hood. An updated remake of the classic 1960s marionette adventure series, this time featuring computer-animated characters on live-action modeled sets. With the voices of Rosamund Pike, Kayvan Novak and Thomas Brodie-Sangster, with the original Parker - David Graham - returning to voice Lady Penelope's long-serving chauffeur.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny goes extreme window cleaning, but will he be brave enough to abseil down the building and avoid the forfeit?.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Madcap slapstick and mayhem as the celebrated cat and mouse plot against each other.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Madcap slapstick and mayhem as the celebrated cat and mouse plot against each other.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Madcap slapstick and mayhem as the celebrated cat and mouse plot against each other.

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks he's on a trip to Translovenia and takes shelter in a mansion owned by a vampire. In reality, this vampire is just Weasel..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean climbs into his favourite tree to stop it from being chopped down..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Fuzzypeg eats the Spuds' fish supper and Dave has to catch another. Things look up when he hooks something, but it turns out to be a whale.

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda: The Paws of Destiny
programme.desc: The four students get too confident with their new and untested skills, and sneak off without permission..

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: Craig of the Creek follows a young boy and his two friends as they go on adventures in a world of untamed, kid-dominated wilderness in the creek.

programme.title: Ainsley's Caribbean Kitchen
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott takes a culinary tour of the Caribbean, visiting the islands that have inspired his cooking. His first stop is Jamaica, where his father grew up. He visits the island's famous Coronation Market and a Rastafarian farm-to-table restaurant, where he learns to make ackee-stuffed ravioli. He also takes a trip to the villa where Ian Fleming created James Bond.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Vegetarian food ideas, presented by Henry Firth and Ian Theasby. First on the menu are Sunday roast, vegan cheese in a toasted sandwich, sticky toffee pudding and snack ideas using avocados. The hosts are joined by actress Sadie Frost, who tries their jalfrezi curry.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo's latest leg begins in the Italian fashion capital of Milan, where he visits an elegant cocktail bar who were the first to introduce the idea of the aperitivo in the city. Its train station is one of the busiest in Europe and it's from here he travels on to the town of Treviglio, the home of Bianchi bikes - the first mass-manufactured bicycle in the world. Gino gets a tour of the factory before test riding one of their latest electric bikes alongside a group of local cyclists. Moving on, he visits the medieval town of Bergamo, where he meets ice-cream maker Niccolo, and visits a co-operative restaurant.

programme.title: The Greek Islands with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Julia visits the picturesque island of Crete, intending to step away from the tourist trail and head deep into its heart to explore the Dikti mountains and its striking plateau of windmills. She meets goat shepherd Giannis, who shows her how he makes cheese using traditional methods. Back on the coast at Rethymno, Julia tries the delicacy baklava, meeting filo pastry expert Giorgos, and also meets master artisan Nico, who expertly makes stringed musical instrument the Cretan lyra. Her journey ends on the stunning but poignant neighbouring island of Spinalonga - once an exiled leper colony.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the latest round of the blind auditions in the spinning-chair singing contest, in which celebrity 'coaches' seek out the nation's best vocal talent. But there is a simple twist - with the four coaches selecting their teams through 'blind auditions', looks play no part in the selection process, meaning each singer is chosen on vocal ability alone. Meghan Trainor is the newest recruit to the judging panel, joining series regulars Olly Murs, Tom Jones and Will.i.am.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Five mystery celebrities battle it out in the singing contest that has taken other countries by storm. The contestants are dressed head to toe in elaborate costumes - Chameleon, Duck, Hedgehog, Queen Bee and Unicorn - designed to hide their identities, while the panel - Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall, Rita Ora and Ken Jeong - tries to guess who they are. By the end of the show, the third celebrity's identity will be revealed and they will be waving goodbye to the show. Joel Dommett hosts the proceedings.

programme.title: Minions (2015)
programme.desc: A race of strange, babbling yellow creatures has served the cause of evil throughout the history of the world. In the 1960s, three of these eternal henchmen get a job working for a criminal genius who is hatching a plot against the British crown - but while carrying out her orders, they uncover a threat to their whole species. Animated comedy, with the voices of Sandra Bullock, Pierre Coffin, Jon Hamm and Michael Keaton.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby host the celebrity skating challenge, joined by judges Christopher Dean, Jayne Torvill, Ashley Banjo and John Barrowman. Another six famous faces make their debut on the ice in the hope of avoiding the skate-off at the end of the show against last week's lowest-scoring performer. There is also a routine by the cast of new musical The Prince of Egypt. The full line-up of celebrities are Ben Hanlin, Caprice, Joe Swash, Ian 'H' Watkins, Kevin Kilbane, Libby Clegg, Lisa George, Lucrezia Millarini, Maura Higgins, Perri Kiely, Trisha Goddard and Radzi Chinyanganya.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: DCI Vera Stanhope investigates the case of murdered entrepreneur Freddie Gill, whose body is found by bailiffs attempting to repossess his house. As she delves into the case, she soon comes to understand that Freddie's professional life is just as turbulent as his family life, and Vera must uncover whether the motive behind Freddie's death comes from the trouble at the heart of his family, a desperate financial crises, or his glances with organised crime. Starring Brenda Blethyn, Kenny Doughty and Jon Morrison.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh & Son: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: The actor Bradley Walsh and his son Barney return for a second series as they embark on another road trip across America together, beginning their journey in Florida, the southernmost point of the country. From there, the pair head to the Palm Beach International Raceway, before getting up close and personal with sharks.

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: An American airline has one of its busiest days as hundreds of people fly to the USA for Thanksgiving, while Heathrow employee Sunita helps a woman who has lost her two-year old daughter. Ground staff use measures to disperse birds from the runway to prevent any collisions with aircraft, resident paramedic Izzy treats a pregnant passenger suffering from serious abdominal pain who is due to fly to Brazil that day and British Airways employees prepare for the inaugural flight of their new 185 million aircraft the Dreamliner.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: Recently single teacher Laura Nielson is set up with Andrew Earlham, a widowed surgeon and the father of one of her students. The two enjoy a first date, but the next day rumours and accusations begin to circulate and the two find themselves entangled in a web of deceit and confusion. Thriller, starring Joanne Froggatt and Ioan Gruffudd, with Shelley Conn, Zoe Tapper and Warren Brown.

programme.title: The Unexplained Files
programme.sub-title: Lost Giants of Georgia/Bridge of Death
programme.desc: In the Borjami Valley, experts uncover bones they believe belong to a human over nine feet tall. Plus, investigating why dogs have been mysteriously jumping from a bridge.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini enters a dusty Saab into the Barn Find competition and takes a vintage electric car for a spin.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini helps a man to build a car collection after restoring his Ferrari Lusso.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that capture a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that capture a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Footage of a dragboat racer ejecting while travelling at 165mph, a 100-ton train crashing into a bus, and a skydiver cartwheeling out of control. Ron Pitts presents a documentary series investigating the natural disasters and accidents that have caused excessive damage, from tornados to plane crashes.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Footage of two million gallons of volatile chemicals exploding, and a daring BMX freestyler plummeting from a 50ft cliff. Ron Pitts presents a documentary series investigating the natural disasters and accidents that have caused large amounts of damage, from tornados to plane crashes.

programme.title: Goblin Works Garage
programme.desc: The team takes on its first ever EV build as its members attempt to mount a Tesla battery-powered electric powerplant inside a classic - the Cinquecento or Fiat 500

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: The team is called in when a woman who has bought her husband a Chevrolet Impala does not have enough money left over to fix it up.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien discover items including baby scales, an oil can and a glass cabinet that are ready for upcycling to turn a profit for their owners.

programme.title: Supercar Superbuild
programme.desc: An insight into the production of Ford's Mustang, which was designed to conform to the firm's objective of building machines that appealed to an international consumer base.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard visits Britain's oldest number plate maker. Plus, Paul and Drew disagree about adding a mega engine onto a tiny Italian classic..

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: A round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League, including Leeds United v Sheffield Wednesday and Charlton Athletic v West Bromwich Albion.

programme.title: Mega Shippers
programme.desc: Documentary profiling the workers responsible for keeping the world's cargo ships on the move 365 days a year. In Southampton dock, Pete Lavelle races to load 750 luxury cars worth over 25million onto Titania, one of the largest vessel carriers in the world.

programme.title: Mega Shippers
programme.desc: In Palma, Majorca, loadmaster Mark McGrane is tasked with transporting a 14million superyacht to its winter home in Florida - during hurricane season.

programme.title: Mega Shippers
programme.desc: Marine officer Gary Olden clears a path in Southampton for the Mathilde. At 400 metres and carrying almost 18,000 containers, it is the biggest ship ever to dock at the port.

programme.title: Mega Shippers
programme.desc: Off the coast of Scotland, the Shetland Islands depend on regular shipments from the mainland. However, Storm Abigail has left supply vessel Daroja stranded in Lerwick.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard visits Britain's oldest number plate maker. Plus, Paul and Drew disagree about adding a mega engine onto a tiny Italian classic..

programme.title: Born Mucky: Life on the Farm
programme.desc: Documentary capturing the reality of life for modern British farmers, exploring the resilience and commitment required to keep farms thriving. A potent pest threatens crops on Tom's farm. Ally tries to save his soya crop from hungry pigeons, while in Shropshire, Ian has inventive plans to improve his rescue pigs' lives.

programme.title: Darts: BDO World Championships
programme.desc: Day seven from indigo at The O2 in London.

programme.title: Live Darts: BDO World Championships
programme.desc: Coverage of the men's final on day eight from indigo at the O2 in London.

programme.title: Goblin Works Garage
programme.desc: The team takes on its first ever EV build as its members attempt to mount a Tesla battery-powered electric powerplant inside a classic - the Cinquecento or Fiat 500

programme.title: Border Control: Spain
programme.desc: Follows the interventions of the Security and Customs Services at the borders of Spain who are under the constant threat from drugs, weapons, and suspected terrorists.

programme.title: Border Control: Spain
programme.desc: Follows the interventions of the Security and Customs Services at the borders of Spain who are under the constant threat from drugs, weapons, and suspected terrorists.

programme.title: Inside Death Row with Trevor McDonald
programme.desc: Part one of two. The broadcaster ventures inside Indiana State Prison, meeting 12 condemned men awaiting execution and some of the other inmates in the maximum-security facility. Among those he talks to are Benjamin Ritchie, who murdered a policeman, and John Stephenson, who killed three people on the orders of a gang boss, while James Harrison reveals how he escaped the death penalty with only weeks to spare after accepting a deal of life inside. Trevor also visits the 1950s-style barber shop where all the hairdressers are convicts, including Rick Pearish, who explains why they are given permission to use cut-throat razors and sharp implements.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How cutting-edge technology is being used to solve murder cases more than a decade old, with a look at the kinds of information detectives search for when fresh clues are scarce.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: Breaking Bad earned its place among the greatest dramas in TV history. However, one fan became nearly as famous when he copied the show's most gut-wrenching, twisted idea.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of Erica Vassell, who disappeared after a party in Clewiston, Florida. When her brutally murdered body was found days later, friends were left in shock and fear.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The story of an undercover operation, codenamed 'Safe Bet', which targeted corrupt police officers and their connections with the Chicago Mafia.

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.desc: The team tries to break up an illegal cock-fighting ring, while officer Sadler saves a dog from a fire and Johnson takes urgent action against a cruel pet owner.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown goes on a dangerous mission to capture a monster python called Big Mamma.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A shih tzu needs an urgent transfusion when she begins bleeding from her bowel.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride wants a colourful gown to go with her theme for the big day, but her mother has other ideas. A customer looks for a dress that will make a dramatic impression.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Saralyn is in need of two dresses to share her wedding with her sister, and Rachel brings her sibling to help her make a decision.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Lavina has walked down the aisle 15 times as a bridesmaid, and now it is finally her turn to be the bride, while staff member Jennifer makes a series of rookie mistakes.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: An unusual patient turns up in the form of an albino echidna, and Chris is invited to Symbio Wildlife Park to carry out a highly dangerous procedure on a female Sumatran tiger.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Harriet the Bearded Dragon has a worrying lump on the side of her leg that requires an urgent operation, and a sick 10-week-old puppy is put in danger by her protective owner.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Mother-of-five Cynthia weighs 610 pounds and is physically unable to carry on her job as a special needs teacher. She resolves to lose weight for the sake of her career and her family.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: An update on the stories of obese Americans who set out to turn their lives around. Erica must return to California to continue her weight loss, but fears past emotional trauma will derail her. Doug's fight to find his identity threatens his progress.

programme.title: Curvy Brides
programme.sub-title: A Diva and an Opera Singer Walk Into a Bridal Shop
programme.desc: A gospel singer and an opera diva both visit the salon, and Yukia cannot resist trying to impress them with her own vocals.

programme.title: Curvy Brides
programme.desc: The sisters are touched by the stories of fathers of the bride who visit their shop, and decide they need to pay more attention to their own dad.

programme.title: Curvy Brides
programme.sub-title: Brides That Inspire And A Project Prom Flyer
programme.desc: Yukia and Yuneisia are inspired by two brides who work to help others and collect dress donations for an appeal.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride who loves peacocks and another who loves purple battle with their bridesmaids, while another prays pink dresses will save her wedding day.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Selfish sisters are running wild in the salon, causing dress-shopping chaos for the brides. Lori and her team race to control the sibling rivalry.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A woman wants fur muffs but her maid of honour is not keen. Meanwhile, a bride's friend refuses to be a maid unless she gets the dress she wants.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Two brides leave their maids to choose their own dresses, but Lori has to take control to make sure they do not go down the aisle looking too unusual.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.sub-title: A Tale of Two Bridesmaids' Dresses
programme.desc: Bride Julie is fighting with her party because she wants two different dresses - one for bridesmaids and one for the honorary bridesmaids.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Lori does not normally allow men in her salon, but when a group of brides ignore her and the lads start to cause chaos, her team must take control.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Meghan is angry with her maid of honour for stealing the limelight, while LaToya's choice of dress causes a wardrobe malfunction for her bridesmaid.

programme.title: Being Reuben
programme.desc: Welsh school boy and internet sensation Reuben de Maid is chasing his dream of becoming famous. He reflects on the bullying he has endured both online and in real life.

programme.title: Being Reuben
programme.desc: Grandad Bampa takes the kids camping for the weekend. Later on, Reuben has a photoshoot for a brand-new beauty app and brings Bampa along to show him his world.

programme.title: Little People, Big World
programme.desc: Busy dwarf mum Amy Roloff is too stressed to celebrate her wedding anniversary, and explains how she copes with two jobs and four children already taller than herself.

programme.title: Little People, Big World
programme.desc: Matt Roloff takes his twin boys camping, but both he and son Zach experience problems due to their physical limitations.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.desc: A woman enlists Lisa Joyner's help as she tries to track down her birth mother. However, in the process they unearth a secret that has remained hidden for 40 years.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: Experts analyse a man's deception following the 2017 Manchester Arena terror attack. Police tapes expose the lies of a man who murdered his wife and hid her body in the freezer.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Estranged brothers John and Lonnie are complete opposites. Now, they're united by their need to lose weight while they still can - and save their relationship.
